entries.content: Typing indicator bug fix - Found that UserUIController.disableUI() is setting input placeholder to "Agent is working..." which duplicates the typing indicator. The real typing indicator should only appear in the message list via AgentMessagesManager.createPlaceholder(). Need to remove the placeholder text from disableUI() call.

Analysis of placeholder issue: The HTML has default placeholder "Type your message..." but when disableUI() is called, it no longer sets the placeholder back. The flow is:
1. enableUI() calls setPlaceholder('Type your message...') ‚úÖ
2. disableUI() now does NOT call setPlaceholder() anymore ‚ùå

The problem: when input gets disabled, the placeholder that was set during the last state remains. If it was previously "Agent is working...", it stays that way even after our fix.

Solution: disableUI() should either:
- Keep the current placeholder unchanged (don't modify it), OR
- Explicitly restore it to the default "Type your message..."

Need to understand: what should the placeholder be when input is disabled?

IMPORTANT CLARIFICATION: The input placeholder should NEVER change regardless of agent state. It should always remain "Type your message..." whether agent is busy or active. The typing indicator (matrix spinner + "Processing...") should ONLY appear in the message list where the next agent message will appear. The input field just gets disabled (can't type) but its placeholder text stays the same always.

ROOT CAUSE FOUND: There are TWO different state change events:
1. ui.state.change.v1 (DEPRECATED) - states: 'agent_busy', 'active'
2. ui.agent.state.change.v1 (NEW) - states: 'busy', 'active'

Extension is NOW emitting: ui.agent.state.change.v1
MessageManagerRouter is STILL listening to: ui.state.change.v1 (deprecated)

Result: MessageManagerRouter NEVER receives the event, so createPlaceholder() is NEVER called!

Solution: Update MessageManagerRouter to listen to the NEW event 'ui.agent.state.change.v1' and handle state 'busy' instead of 'agent_busy'.

Successfully fixed typing indicator placement. The indicator now appears ONLY in the message list (where next agent message will be) with matrix spinner + "Processing..." text. Input placeholder always stays "Type your message..." regardless of agent state. 

Key changes:
1. MessageManagerRouter now listens to 'ui.agent.state.change.v1' (was 'ui.state.change.v1')
2. State check changed from 'agent_busy' to 'busy' to match new event payload
3. Deprecated AgentTypingIndicatorController (old duplicate system)
4. UserUIController.disableUI() no longer changes input placeholder

Result: Clean single source of truth for typing indicator - AgentMessagesManager.createPlaceholder() is the ONLY place that shows agent activity status in UI.

NEXT SESSION PLAN - Widget System for Paste Events:

Widget 1: Text/Code Clipboard Widget
- Intercept Ctrl+V paste event for text/code
- Create compact visual chip/badge (e.g., "üìã Pasted content (245 chars)")
- Keep input field clean - actual content attached but hidden from view
- User gets visual feedback without messy text dump

Widget 2: Image Thumbnail Widget
- Intercept Ctrl+V paste event for images
- Show small thumbnail above/near the input area
- Visual preview of pasted image
- Possibly add remove (X) button
- Clean visual attachment system

Goal: Make paste interactions professional and visual like Slack/Discord
- Clean input field always
- Clear visual feedback of attached content
- Modern UX for content attachments

Note: Tooltip widget will be separate feature - wait on that for now.
